resources.string: Cleat Hitch
Securing lines to dock cleats.
Take one and a half turns around the base of the cleat.
Wrap the working end diagonally across the top, under the horn, and diagonally back.
Bring the end back and place under the first cross.
Figure of Eight
Tying the ends of lines to prevent them from pulling through blocks.
Make a small loop near the end of the line.
Pass the end of the line around the start and back through the loop.
Pull both ends firmly.
Rolling Hitch
Tying a line to another or to a spar.
Wrap the working end around the stationary object.
Make a second complete turn and cross the second over the first.
Make a third turn but this time cross over the stationary part.
Reef Knot
Tying a rope to itself.
Take one end in each hand and pass one over and around the other.
Cross the ends the opposite way.
Make symmetrical and pull together.
